text:
Filename: about.qmd ```markdown ‚Äî title: ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù format: html ‚Äî

About This Site
Here‚Äôs a simple sine wave plot:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np
x = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, 100) y = np.sin(x)
plt.plot(x, y) plt.title(‚ÄúSine Wave‚Äù) plt.show()

Taylor R. Luckenbill


39 Charnwood Rd. Apt. 3, Somerville, MA 02144 ‚óè (570) 640-6762‚Ä¢ tluck1531@gmail.com


Professional Experience


Sr.¬†Solution Architect ‚Äì Supply Chain Planning




Plan to Produce IT Lead on a fifty-million-dollar transformational agenda focused on replacing legacy ERP and other legacy systems.




IT Lead for implementation of Infor Food and Beverage Suite as well as the Advanced SUpply Chain Planning extension, which covers constraint based supply planning, harvest containment model, demand planning model, production scheduling model, and a recipe management model.




Responsible for IT support and enhancement of the monthly S&OP cycle, which has included the implementation of an application supporting an interface layer, data layer, reporting layer, and review layer. This enhancement moved a disconnected loose file based process into a single closed environment.




Enterprise Systems PMO supporting all vendor, PO, and budget inquiries for the Enterprise Systems department for both the ERP project as well as the yearly fiscal budget.




Currently serving as the co-director of enterprise systems as Welch‚Äôs looks to backfill the posmition.





Business Process Improvement| Enterprise Project Portfolio Management| Trade Promotion Management| Data Analytics| Product Management| Cross Functional Team Building| Leadership| Strategic Planning| Growth Mindset| Executive Level Communication| Customer Service| Product Information Management


PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE


Welch Foods Inc., Concord, MA 2020 ‚Äì Present


Sr.¬†Solution Delivery Lead ‚Äì Sales and Marketing




Sales and Marketing IT Lead on a multi-million-dollar transformational agenda focused on replacing legacy ERP and other legacy systems.




Organized and managed a team of Sales and Marketing business resources to insure three-in-a-box project management approach focused on business led decision making supported by IT.




Completed a phase 0 analysis which included documenting pain points, requirements, asset inventories, and a system-by-system assessment of the Sales and Marketing future state design.




Provided estimates of preparation, decommissioning, and integration activities beyond the defined scope of the ERP system and systems implementer partner.




Socialized information across the organization to ensure alignment and confidence in the project.




Identified areas of shadow IT in the category management function and ensured that the systems, processes, responsibilities were incorporated into the IT center of excellence.






Continued an approach of continuous improvement of systems and processes.




Implemented enhancements to the Blacksmith auto-clearing functionality to allow the accounts receivables team to clear many deductions at once with the goal of reducing the monthly open deductions balance.




Partnered with Trade Promotions vendor to accelerate standard improvements in deduction dollar allocation at the item level to ensure accrual and matched deduction data is increasingly more accurate at lower levels of detail on the general ledger.




Partnered with Trade Promotions vendor to created new standard functionality to enable forecasting of the raw materials business and then developed an automated template using Power Query to extract the materials forecast, format it, and import into the Trade Promotion Management system.




Continued to drive reporting improvements through partnering with our BI team to move static daily reports into Power BI.




Conducted discovery on the Product Information Management process and identified key areas of improvement and standardization, presented the recommendations, and initiated a capital project to develop net new functionality for Salsify to achieve a steady state of operations.




Worked with cross functional team to ensure website met ADA compliance requirements to ensure government funding was not restricted.






Developed solution architects to increase responsibilities in line with career aspirations.




Worked with direct reports to create a development plan to increase team competencies starting with Sales competencies and moving into Marketing concepts.






Assisted in managing Sales and Marketing functions through a cyber attack which halted operations for several days.




Managed a list of recovery items and remediation requests from external parties to ensure restoration of all Sales and Marketing processes.






Solution Delivery Lead ‚Äì Sales and Marketing




Expanded responsibilities to all IT people, processes, and technology across Sales and Marketing functions.




Continued responsibilities as the subject matter expert on Product Information Management and Trade Promotion Management in Blacksmith, Oracle, Salsify, and 1WorldSync.




Member of the IT Leadership Team.




Managed two solution architects focused on maintaining the data and functionality of Sales and Marketing systems.




Set the capital and operating budget for Sales and Marketing IT.




Defined the immediate, mid-term, and long-term investments and strategy for all Sales and Marketing systems.




Supported the broker commission process ensuring correct rates and reporting requirements.




Expanded IT support responsibilities to include category management, media spend management, product lifecycle management, customer insights, product innovation, and brand management.




Initiated discovery activities and made recommendation about how to incorporate our raw materials business into the enterprise outlook.






Implemented an approach of continuous improvement of systems and processes.




Delivered enhancements to trade reporting for food service indirect distributors, pre-promotional what-if scenario planning, and automated templates for check request trade payments.




Expanded the reach of digital product information sharing by gaining capital approval and implementing Syndigo Marketplace, which allows for data synchronization with 100+ retailers that previously required manual communication.




Identified resourcing gaps within the Marketing team and gained approval to bring on a managed services partner to ensure timely and accurate product information sharing.






Business Process Specialist ‚Äì Sales and Marketing




Team lead on $125k cross-functional Trade Promotion Management software implementation (Blacksmith) to replace existing Trade Promotion Management system. The project was completed on time, and on budget.




Performed extensive value stream mapping and create business cases with a range of projected ROIs and payback periods.




Gained project approval from the executive leadership team after conducting a competitive RFP and contract negotiation with several vendors.




Successfully restructured Welch‚Äôs customer hierarchy in Oracle ERP to eliminate input errors and standardize the level at which all promotional events are planned.




Estimated 3000 hrs. /yr. in non-value work eliminated and $130k in Food Service trade reductions expected from the project.








Responsible for ensuring the quality and accuracy of Welch‚Äôs product information published to external partners.




Configured and published product data, images, and descriptions to retailer websites such as Walmart and Target.




Managed product specification updates in Oracle ERP, Salsify, and 1WorldSync to ensure the accuracy and quality of information shared with external customers.




Worked closely with the Marketing and Sales teams to ensure information shared with all customers are consistent and optimal relative to retailer specific content quality scores.






Provided IT support for the sales planning, accounts receivable, and field sales departments in all systems.




Trained new employees on Trade Promotion Management system (Oracle Demantra) and resolve support tickets on invoicing price mismatches and promotion errors.




Improved sales planning process by creating Power BI dashboard that automatically aggregates all sales plans into one actionable dashboard.






Origlio Beverage Inc., Philadelphia, PA 2018 ‚Äì2020


Business Analyst




Conducted a feasibility study and presented findings to the CTO regarding the migration of company analytics from Tableau to Amazon Quicksight.




The project saved the department $15,000 a year and exponentially increased our user base from 39 partitioned licenses to 200 employees in the organization.






Managed the implementation of ADP Enhanced Time accounting software to improve hourly wage expense management within the warehouse operations department.




Researched software options, scheduled demos, and presented the recommendation to Vice President.




Lead a cross-department team of six employees and trained warehouse managers.




The implementation was completed two months ahead of schedule, allowed for more accurate monitoring of wages, and saved the company a day of payroll preparation per period.






Served as the primary reporting and analytics resource for the entire organization




Created dynamic warehouse manager dashboards in Tableau using SQL, data blending, and set action techniques that resulted in an 18,000-unit reduction in order errors per year.




Gathered data from multiple sources, combined the data using a left join, performed data splits, and packaged the information together into a department specific KPI report, which provided customer service managers with the ability to consistently evaluate their team‚Äôs performance.






One of two people responsible for managing the pricing database.




Set up supplier laid in costs and maintained pricing to retailers.




Created promotions and determining rebate amounts.




Responsible for contract verification with all suppliers and ensuring all contracts were sent to and registered by the Pennsylvania Liquor Control Board.




Improved the sales department‚Äôs new product approval process by simplifying the existing workflow and introducing automation through Microsoft Power Apps, saving sales reps about one hour a day of data entry.




The Vanguard Group, Malvern, PA 2017 ‚Äì2018


Brokerage Investments Professional




Analyzed quarterly financial and economic reports to maintain a current understanding of market conditions to provide the best possible service to clients.




Helped clients understand difficult topics such as asset allocation and the benefits of long-term perspective during difficult economic downturns.




Performed investment guidance and account maintenance services at above average quality based on company devised performance metrics.




Selected to tutor incoming Vanguard employees on debt, equity, and legal topics for licensing exams.




Led team-learning initiatives on difficult financial topics like expense ratios for a mutual fund and derivatives contracts.




EDUCATION



Master of Science, Applied Business Analytics 2021-Current


Boston University, Metropolitan College - Boston, MA


STEM Designated, Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business Accredited


Bachelor of Science, Finance and Economics Double Major 2013-2017


Susquehanna University, Sigmund Weis School of Business - Selinsgrove, PA


Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business Accredited



Organizations and Community Service



Special Olympics Massachusetts Volunteer


Special Olympics Pennsylvania Volunteer


Susquehanna University Varsity Baseball


Student Financial Analyst: River Hawk Investment Fund


Student Financial Analyst: CFA Institute Research Challenge
